lead_paragraph: A former hedge fund manager accused of defrauding dozens of investors, including the former Denver Broncos quarterback John Elway, in a $71 million Ponzi scheme has pleaded guilty to charges of theft, securities fraud and violating Colorado's organized crime law.

headline.main: Fund Manager Pleads Guilty in Ponzi Scheme

abstract: A former hedge fund manager accused of defrauding dozens of investors, including former Denver Broncos quarterback John Elway, in a $71 million Ponzi scheme pleaded guilty Monday to charges of theft, securities fraud and violating Colorado's organized crime law.
